intro: Chamaesyce missurica var. calcicola, commonly known as the calcicola sandbur, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, hairless leaves and small yellow flowers. This plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. It is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a pioneer species in disturbed environments. The plant's morphology reflects its evolutionary adaptation to arid and semi-arid climates.
